      • startBetting

        public void startBetting(Player p1,
                         Player p2,
                         Dealer d,
                         Betting b)
        Method clears hands, sets position counter to zero and shuffles deck 3 times. Used before hand starts
        Parameters:
        p1 - user player
        p2 - casino player
        d - used dealer object
        b - used betting object

      • addCardImage

        public void addCardImage(Player p,
                         JPanel jp,
                         Dealer d)
        Method adds card image to given JPanel.
        Parameters:
        p - given player
        jp - given player's JPanel
        d - used dealer object

      • dealCard

        public ImageIcon dealCard(Player p,
                          Dealer d)
        Method adds card to given player object. Both player and dealer. Returns dealt card image icon used to show what has been dealt.
        Parameters:
        p - player dealt card
        d - dealer object dealing cards
        Returns:
        dealt card's image icon
        See Also:
        Player.getHand(), Hand.addCard(Card), Dealer.dealCard(int), Card.getImageIcon()

      • getHandValue

        public int getHandValue(Player p)
        Method returns given player's smallest hand value. Used by both user and casino player objects.
        Parameters:
        p - given player
        Returns:
        player's hand value
        See Also:
        Hand.getHandValue()

      • getBiggestValidHandValue

        public int getBiggestValidHandValue(Player p)
        Method returns hand value with biggest value. Needed because Ace has value of 1 and 11.
        Parameters:
        p - given player
        Returns:
        player's biggest hand value
        See Also:
        Hand.getHighestValidHand()

      • printHandValue

        public String printHandValue(Player p)
        Method used to show current hand values to player. Showing both values when ace in hand and bigger value less than 22
        Parameters:
        p - given player
        Returns:
        hand value using string
        See Also:
        Player.getHand(), Hand.getHandValue(), Hand.getHandValueWithAce()
